headline.main: South Sudan: Why Things Fall Apart

docs.snippet: South Sudan shows complex crises left to fester for decades are seldom fixed with a sudden burst of action....
docs.abstract: South Sudan shows complex crises left to fester for decades are seldom fixed with a sudden burst of action.
docs.lead_paragraph: Heightened tensions over oil threatens the fragile peace between Sudan and South Sudan, as my colleague Jeffrey Gettleman reports. For me, the story and the predicament recall a meeting long ago, before oil was even discovered in Sudan.

docs.abstract: Emperor Akihito of Japan will undergo heart bypass surgery on Saturday in Tokyo, the emperor's office said Sunday, as reported by the Kyodo news agency. The Imperial Household Agency made the announcement after Akihito, 78, had received a detailed heart exam.

headline.main: Japanese Emperor Akihito to Undergo Heart Bypass Surgery

docs.snippet: Emperor Akihito of Japan will undergo heart bypass surgery on Saturday in Tokyo, the emperor's office said Sunday, as reported by the Kyodo news agency. The Imperial Household Agency made the announcement after Akihito, 78, had received a detailed...
docs.abstract: Emperor Akihito of Japan will undergo heart bypass surgery on Saturday in Tokyo, the emperor's office said Sunday, as reported by the Kyodo news agency. The Imperial Household Agency made the announcement after Akihito, 78, had received a detailed heart exam.
docs.lead_paragraph: Emperor Akihito of Japan will undergo heart bypass surgery on Saturday in Tokyo, the emperor's office said Sunday, as reported by the Kyodo news agency. The Imperial Household Agency made the announcement after Akihito, 78, had received a detailed heart examination. Kyodo reported that the catheter angiogram was performed after the emperor "displayed symptoms of a minor ischemic change while recently engaging in light exercise.'' The Mainichi Daily News reported that Akihito, who took the throne in 1989, had an angiogram last February. "At that time,'' the paper said Sunday, "the emperor's doctors found that the artery providing oxygen and nourishment to the heart muscle was narrowing and hardening.'' Read more »

headline.main: New Study Points to Unknown Nuclear Tests by North Korea in 2010

docs.snippet: A new study by a Swedish scientist argues that a North Korean claim to have achieved nuclear fusion in 2010 might not be so ridiculous. In his analysis of radioisotope emissions, Lars-Erik De Geer suggests that North Korea may have conducted two h...
docs.abstract: A new study by a Swedish scientist argues that a North Korean claim to have achieved nuclear fusion in 2010 might not be so ridiculous. In his analysis of radioisotope emissions, Lars-Erik De Geer suggests that North Korea may have conducted two heretofore-unknown nuclear weapons tests in 2010.

headline.main: New Study Points to Unknown Nuclear Tests by North Korea in 2010

docs.snippet: A new study by a Swedish scientist argues that a North Korean claim to have achieved nuclear fusion in 2010 might not be so ridiculous. In his analysis of radioisotope emissions, Lars-Erik De Geer suggests that North Korea may have conducted two h...
docs.abstract: A new study by a Swedish scientist argues that a North Korean claim to have achieved nuclear fusion in 2010 might not be so ridiculous. In his analysis of radioisotope emissions, Lars-Erik De Geer suggests that North Korea may have conducted two heretofore-unknown nuclear weapons tests in 2010.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea - It was May 12, 2010, and a story on the front page of North Korea's leading state-run newspaper declared that the country's scientists had achieved nuclear fusion.
